reviews.review_msg: Graham has been my favourite prof so far at SFU. I took Media and Ideology with him and he gave a real in depth course in ideology, it was great. He definitely knows what he is talking about and I learned a lot! He doesn't use lecture slides or anything but if you pay attention and take notes it isn't a big deal! Really accessible for help as well.

If you are looking for 'structured learning' as a poster below noted, stay away from anything Gruneau teaches!! What you get instead is passion, incredible insight and flashes of real brilliance. Fair trade I'd say. This class inspired me to apply to grad school.

Can only speak about my own experience but I found Gruneau to be extremely helpful. He was always available for discussion and he went out of his way to write several reference letters for me. As for course content I thought 410 was the most comprehensive and challenging course I took in Communications.

At his best gruneau is surely one of the best lecturers at SFU. He has an aptitude for synthesizing ideas and theories, and for explaining difficult concepts, that is unique. He can wander a bit sometimes but  most often his apparent  digressions reveal themselves to serve the point he is trying to make. Amazing prof and one of a kind.

I was nervous about taking 410 because I heard it was hard and a lot of work. But Gruneau has a great way of explaining things and he made the class enjoyable. In the end I thought it was a great course.

Withing 3 weeks of sitting in 410 you just get the impression you are in a whole other league from the rest of the courses in communications. This was the best course in 5 years at SFU and Gruneau weaves a theoretical story in the class that is nothing short of brilliant.
